title: Sculpting in Time - Tarkovsky, The Great Russian Filmaker Discus
description:
Sculpting in Time: Tarkovsky The Great Russian Filmaker Discusses His Art By Andrey Tarkovsky 
University of Texas Press | 256 Pages | 1989 | ISBN : 0292776241 | PDF | 3MB


Andrey Tarkovsky, the genius of modern Russian cinemaÃ¢â‚¬â€hailed by Ingmar Bergman as "the most important director of our time"Ã¢â‚¬â€died an exile in Paris in December 1986. In Sculpting in Time, he has left his artistic testament, a remarkable revelation of both his life and work. Since Ivan's Childhood won the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival in 1962, the visionary quality and totally original and haunting imagery of Tarkovsky's films have captivated serious movie audiences all over the world, who see in his work a continuation of the great literary traditions of nineteenth-century Russia. Many critics have tried to interpret his intensely personal vision, but he himself always remained inaccessible.

In Sculpting in Time, Tarkovsky sets down his thoughts and his memories, revealing for the first time the original inspirations for his extraordinary filmsÃ¢â‚¬â€Ivan's Childhood, Andrey Rublyov, Solaris, The Mirror, Stalker, Nostalgia, and The Sacrifice. He discusses their history and his methods of work, he explores the many problems of visual creativity, and he sets forth the deeply autobiographical content of part of his oeuvreÃ¢â‚¬â€most fascinatingly in The Mirror and Nostalgia. The closing chapter on The Sacrifice, dictated in the last weeks of Tarkovsky's life, makes the book essential reading for those who already know or who are just discovering his magnificent work.
